displaytitle: Pure to the Core (Qing ru gu 清入骨)
creditline: Gift of Yoshiaki Shimizu, Graduate School Class of 1975
markings:
Characters and seals in ink on wooden box

Artist inscription:
"Wangqi bimo" 忘其筆墨, square relief, top
"Fu Shen" square intaglio, bottom
inscribed:
Text (in clerical script): 清入骨  "Pure to the Core"

Artist inscriptions:
清水兄出句
[屬]寫    辛亥（1971）
君約傅申
Elder brother Shimizu provided the phrase, which I wrote.  1971, Junyue Fu Shen.

十年前為清水同學書於普林斯頓未用印。今同事於
佛利爾已二年餘裝成並請補印遂記此。辛酉（1981）初秋
君約于華府
When I wrote this ten years ago for my fellow student Shimizu at Princeton, I did not use a seal.  Now as colleagues at the Freer Gallery for over two years, it has been mounted, and when I was asked to add my seals I wrote this in early fall 1981.  Junyue in Washington DC.

titles.title: Pure to the Core (Qing ru gu 清入骨)

makers.displaydate: born 1937, Shanghai, China; active Taiwan and United States
makers.displaymaker: Fu Shen 傅申, born 1937, Shanghai, China; active Taiwan and United States

texts.textentryhtml:
Text 
(in clerical script)
清入骨  
Pure to the Core

Artist's inscriptions (2)
清水兄出句
[屬]寫    辛亥（1971）
君約傅申
Elder brother Shimizu provided the phrase, which I wrote.  1971, Junyue Fu Shen.

十年前為清水同學書於普林斯頓未用印。今同事於
佛利爾已二年餘裝成並請補印遂記此。辛酉（1981）初秋
君約于華府
When I wrote this ten years ago for my fellow student Shimizu at Princeton, I did not use a seal.  Now as colleagues at the Freer Gallery for over two years, it has been mounted, and when I was asked to add my seals I wrote this in early fall 1981.  Junyue in Washington DC.

Seals:	"Wangqi bimo" 忘其筆墨 sq. relief, top
		"Fu Shen" sq. intaglio, bottom

Artist's inscription on wood box
傅君約隸書清入骨橫幅
辛亥書於普林斯頓大學。甲子夏君約自署時
清水兄將離華府再返普城
Clerical script "Pure to the Core" horizontal scroll by Fu Junyue.  
Brushed in 1971 at Princeton University.  In the summer of 1984 when Junyue signed this [box], elder brother Shimizu is about to leave Washington DC to return again to Princeton.

Seals: (5)

1971–1971 Fu Shen, born 1937, by gift to Yoshiaki Shimizu (Princeton, NJ).

–2009 Yoshiaki Shimizu (Princeton, NJ), by gift to the Princeton University Art Museum, 2009.

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Princeton University Art Museum 2009," Record of the Princeton University Art Museum 69 (2010): p. 51-85.
bibliography.citation: "Acquisitions of the Princeton University Art Museum 2009," Record of the Princeton University Art Museum 69 (2010): p. 51-85., p. 52
